title: Cohomology and Decomposition of Tensor Product Representations of SL(2,R)
abstract: We analyze the decomposition of tensor products of infinite dimensional discrete series (unitary) and finite-dimensional (non-unitary) representations of SL(2,R). Although such tensor products are not in general completely reducible, we show that the product representations become completely reducible on the cohomology of a natural nilpotent operator Q derived from the Casimir. We introduce a definition of the character of a representation compatible with the cohomology and use these characters to derive explicit tensor product decomposition formulae.
